summary: “Herd immunity” can happen once a large part of a population—say 70-90%—develops immunity to a disease. This generally happens by infection (conferring natural immunity) or vaccination. Herd immunity can help slow or stop a disease’s spread, but many people may die before it happens. It is currently unclear how herd immunity could happen for COVID-19 . For example, the data are insufficient to show how...
title: Science & Tech Spotlight: Herd Immunity For COVID-19
